<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// When a loop exit edge is split, LCSSA form may require new PHIs in the new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// exit block. This function inserts the new PHIs, as needed. Preds is a list</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of preds inside the loop, SplitBB is the new loop exit block, and DestBB is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the old loop exit, now the successor of SplitBB.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa650642c90f81466c2cd062e00ab152b">createPHIsForSplitLoopExit</a>(ArrayRef&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; Preds,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                BasicBlock &#42;SplitBB, BasicBlock &#42;DestBB);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If this edge is a critical edge, insert a new node to split the critical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// edge. This will update the analyses passed in through the option struct.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This returns the new block if the edge was split, null otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If MergeIdenticalEdges in the options struct is true (not the default),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42;all&#42; edges from TI to the specified successor will be merged into the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// critical edge block. This is most commonly interesting with switch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions, which may have many edges to any one destination.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ensures that all edges to that dest go to one block instead of each going</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to a different block, but isn&#39;t the standard definition of a &quot;critical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// edge&quot;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It is invalid to call this function on a critical edge that starts at an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// IndirectBrInst.  Splitting these edges will almost always create an invalid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// program because the address of the new block won&#39;t be the one that is jumped</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab61955a622d233750894890e0704da5c">SplitCriticalEdge</a>(Instruction &#42;TI, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SuccNum,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CriticalEdgeSplittingOptions &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/lib/debuginfo/logicalview/core/lvoptions-cpp/#ab4088b7a11f3cbc38ac16a6e9c72494e">Options</a> =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  CriticalEdgeSplittingOptions(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Twine &amp;BBName = </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If it is known that an edge is critical, SplitKnownCriticalEdge can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// called directly, rather than calling SplitCriticalEdge first.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This method introduces at least one new basic block into the function and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// moves some of the predecessors of BB to be predecessors of the new block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The new predecessors are indicated by the Preds array. The new block is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// given a suffix of &#39;Suffix&#39;. Returns new basic block to which predecessors</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from Preds are now pointing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If BB is a landingpad block then additional basicblock might be introduced.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It will have Suffix+&quot;.split&#95;lp&quot;. See SplitLandingPadPredecessors for more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// details on this case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This currently updates the LLVM IR, DominatorTree, LoopInfo, and LCCSA but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// no other analyses. In particular, it does not preserve LoopSimplify</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (because it&#39;s complicated to handle the case where one of the edges being</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This method transforms the landing pad, OrigBB, by introducing two new basic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// blocks into the function. One of those new basic blocks gets the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// predecessors listed in Preds. The other basic block gets the remaining</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// predecessors of OrigBB. The landingpad instruction OrigBB is clone into both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of the new basic blocks. The new blocks are given the suffixes &#39;Suffix1&#39; and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#39;Suffix2&#39;, and are returned in the NewBBs vector.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This currently updates the LLVM IR, DominatorTree, LoopInfo, and LCCSA but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// no other analyses. In particular, it does not preserve LoopSimplify</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (because it&#39;s complicated to handle the case where one of the edges being</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// split is an exit of a loop with other exits).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a949b0428c89b8ccf62d469bd325244ed">SplitLandingPadPredecessors</a>(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Suffix2, SmallVectorImpl&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; &amp;NewBBs,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This method duplicates the specified return instruction into a predecessor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// which ends in an unconditional branch. If the return instruction returns a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value defined by a PHI, propagate the right value into the return. It</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// returns the new return instruction in the predecessor.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Split the containing block at the specified instruction - everything before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SplitBefore stays in the old basic block, and the rest of the instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the BB are moved to a new block. The two blocks are connected by a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// conditional branch (with value of Cmp being the condition).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Before:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Head</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   SplitBefore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Tail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// After:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Head</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   if (Cond)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     ThenBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   SplitBefore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Tail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p ThenBlock is not specified, a new block will be created for it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p Unreachable is true, the newly created block will end with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// UnreachableInst, otherwise it branches to Tail.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns the NewBasicBlock&#39;s terminator.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Updates DTU and LI if given.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlight">Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad957413955739c91204c96e33e0cc933">SplitBlockAndInsertIfThen</a>(Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> SplitBefore,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Split the containing block at the specified instruction - everything before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SplitBefore stays in the old basic block, and the rest of the instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the BB are moved to a new block. The two blocks are connected by a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// conditional branch (with value of Cmp being the condition).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Before:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Head</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   SplitBefore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Tail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// After:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Head</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   if (Cond)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     TrueBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">////    FalseBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   SplitBefore</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   Tail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p ThenBlock is null, the resulting CFG won&#39;t contain the TrueBlock. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p ThenBlock is non-null and points to non-null BasicBlock pointer, that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// block will be inserted as the TrueBlock. Otherwise a new block will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// created. Likewise for the \\p ElseBlock parameter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p UnreachableThen or \\p UnreachableElse is true, the corresponding newly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// created blocks will end with UnreachableInst, otherwise with branches to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Tail. The function will not modify existing basic blocks passed to it. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// caller must ensure that Tail is reachable from Head.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns the newly created blocks in \\p ThenBlock and \\p ElseBlock.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Updates DTU and LI if given.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7ac00229d8c59902686f52ed061cdc80">SplitBlockAndInsertIfThenElse</a>(Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Check whether BB is the merge point of a if-region.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If so, return the branch instruction that determines which entry into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BB will be taken.  Also, return by references the block that will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// entered from if the condition is true, and the block that will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// entered if the condition is false.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This does no checking to see if the true/false blocks have large or unsavory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions in them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlight">BranchInst &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1a5751a2dd7306ff9a59eae6c1de8925">GetIfCondition</a>(BasicBlock &#42;BB, BasicBlock &#42;&amp;IfTrue,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">                           BasicBlock &#42;&amp;IfFalse);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Split critical edges where the source of the edge is an indirectbr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction. This isn&#39;t always possible, but we can handle some easy cases.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is useful because MI is unable to split such critical edges,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which means it will not be able to sink instructions along those edges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is especially painful for indirect branches with many successors, where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we end up having to prepare all outgoing values in the origin block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Our normal algorithm for splitting critical edges requires us to update</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the outgoing edges of the edge origin block, but for an indirectbr this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is hard, since it would require finding and updating the block addresses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the indirect branch uses. But if a block only has a single indirectbr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predecessor, with the others being regular branches, we can do it in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// different way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Say we have A -&gt; D, B -&gt; D, I -&gt; D where only I -&gt; D is an indirectbr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We can split D into D0 and D1, where D0 contains only the PHIs from D,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and D1 is the D block body. We can then duplicate D0 as D0A and D0B, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// create the following structure:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A -&gt; D0A, B -&gt; D0A, I -&gt; D0B, D0A -&gt; D1, D0B -&gt; D1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If BPI and BFI aren&#39;t non-null, BPI/BFI will be updated accordingly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When &#96;IgnoreBlocksWithoutPHI&#96; is set to &#96;true&#96; critical edges leading to a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// block without phi-instructions will not be split.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a502009030bffff8a6992f4e4eb9380f5">SplitIndirectBrCriticalEdges</a>(Function &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IgnoreBlocksWithoutPHI,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  BranchProbabilityInfo &#42;BPI = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  BlockFrequencyInfo &#42;BFI = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Utility function for inverting branch condition and for swapping its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// successors</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a70cdc32fcfc8ba3feaf026f4959e2c2a">InvertBranch</a>(BranchInst &#42;PBI, IRBuilderBase &amp;Builder);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check whether the function only has simple terminator:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// br/brcond/unreachable/ret</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2436f015662138f27cf2be735ad740e3">hasOnlySimpleTerminator</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Function &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns true if these basic blocks belong to a presplit coroutine and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// edge corresponds to the &#39;default&#39; case in the switch statement in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pattern:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// %0 = call i8 @llvm.coro.suspend(token none, i1 false)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// switch i8 %0, label %suspend &#91;i8 0, label %resume</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                               i8 1, label %cleanup&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// i.e. the edge to the &#96;%suspend&#96; BB. This edge is special in that it will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be elided by coroutine lowering (coro-split), and the &#96;%suspend&#96; BB needs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to be kept as-is. It&#39;s not a real CFG edge - post-lowering, it will end</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// up being a &#96;ret&#96;, and it must be thus lowerable to support symmetric</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transfer. For example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - this edge is not a loop exit edge if encountered in a loop (and should</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    be ignored)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - must not be split for PGO instrumentation, for example.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4603b4fac07d9342d2ea27067c81057">isPresplitCoroSuspendExitEdge</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BasicBlock &amp;Src,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BasicBlock &amp;Dest);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace llvm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM&#95;TRANSFORMS&#95;UTILS&#95;BASICBLOCKUTILS&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
